contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Lord himself first announced the message about how God will save us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This is salvation that was first announced by the Lord

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who was made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God crowned him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has been crowned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whom he makes holy" or "those whom he makes pure from sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are sanctified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Satan tempted him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was tempted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has considered Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jesus has been considered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "every house has someone who built it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: every house is built by someone

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus would say in the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were to be spoken of in the future

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the deceitfulness of sin does not harden any of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: no one among you will be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For we heard the good news just as they did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For we were told the good news just as they were

contextId.information: The peace and security provided by God are spoken of as if they were rest that he can give, and as if they were a place to which people could go. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God still allows some people to enter his place of rest" or "God still allows some people to experience his blessings of rest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: it is still reserved for some to enter his rest

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Nothing that God has created can hide from him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Nothing created is hidden before God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who has endured temptation in every way that we have" or "whom the devil has tempted in every way that he tempts us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who has in all ways been tempted as we are

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God chooses from among the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: chosen from among people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God also requires him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he also is required

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God called him, just as he called Aaron" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is called by God, just as Aaron was

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God made him perfect" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was made perfect

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to those for whom someone prepared the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to those for whom the land was worked

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the more important person blesses the less important person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the lesser person is blessed by the greater person

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "not be after the manner of Aaron" or "who is not a priest like Aaron" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: not be considered to be after the manner of Aaron

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "about whom I am speaking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: about whom these things are said

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they eventually die and cannot continue on" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: by death they are kept from continuing on

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For God appoints every priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For every high priest is appointed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is just as God warned Moses when Moses was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is just as Moses was warned by God when he was

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that I showed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was shown to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It was this covenant that God made based on better promises" or "God promised better things when he made this covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: which is based on better promises

contextId.information: A tabernacle was constructed and made ready for use. This idea can be stated in active form. AT: "the Israelites prepared a tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a tabernacle was prepared

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After the priests prepared these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: After these things were prepared

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God had not yet revealed the way into the most holy place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the way into the most holy place was not yet revealed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the priests now offer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are now being offered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that God provided until he created the new order" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that were provided until the new order would be created

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that humans hands had not made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was not made by human hands

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whom God has chosen to be his children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active and positive form. AT: "So God established even the first covenant with blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: So not even the first covenant was established without blood

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the priests used in their work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: used in the service

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the priests should use these animal sacrifices to cleanse what are copies of things that are in heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the copies of the things in heaven should be cleansed with these animal sacrifices

contextId.information: That is, better than the sacrifices used to cleanse the earthly copies. This can be stated in active form. AT: "as for the heavenly things themselves, God had to cleanse them with much better sacrifices" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the heavenly things themselves had to be cleansed with much better sacrifices

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Christ also, who offered himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Christ also, who was offered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as the prophets wrote about me in the scroll" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as it is written about me in the scroll

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that priests offer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are offered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as if he made our hearts clean with his blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: having our hearts sprinkled clean

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as if he had washed our bodies in pure water" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: having our bodies washed with pure water

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People ridiculed you by insulting and persecuting you in public" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You were exposed to public ridicule by insults and persecution

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "faith is what allows a person to confidently expect certain things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: faith is the assurance about the things that are confidently expected

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that we still have not seen" or "that still have not happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are still not seen

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God approved of our ancestors because they had faith" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the ancestors were approved for their faith

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God created the universe by commanding it to exist" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the universe was created by God's command

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God declared that Abel was righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was attested to be righteous

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It was by faith that Enoch did not die because God took him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was by faith that Enoch was taken up so that he did not see death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "before God took him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: before he was taken up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "God said that Enoch had pleased him" or 2) "people said that Enoch pleased God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was testified that he had pleased God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form and in other terms. AT: "because God told him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: having been given a divine message

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "about things no one had ever seen before" or "about events that had not happened yet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: about things not yet seen

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when God called him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when he was called

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active and positive form. AT: "God is happy to have them call him their God" or "God is proud to have them say that he is their God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: God is not ashamed to be called their God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when God tested him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when he was tested

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses' parents hid him for three months after he was born" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Moses, when he was born, was hidden for three months by his parents

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "refused to allow people to call him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: refused to be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the water swallowed up the Egyptians" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were swallowed up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Israelites marched around the walls for seven days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they had been circled around for seven days

contextId.information: It is implied that their enemies would release them from prison if they would deny Jesus as Lord. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Others accepted torture rather than release from prison" or "Others allowed their enemies to torture them rather than deny Jesus so that their enemies would release them, and" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Others were tortured, not accepting release

contextId.information: These can be stated in active form. AT: "People mocked and whipped others ... People threw stones at others. People sawed others in two. People killed others with the sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Others had testing in mocking and whippings ... They were stoned. They were sawn in two. They were killed with the sword

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God honored all these because of their faith, but they did not themselves receive what God had promised" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Although all these people were approved by God because of their faith, they did not receive the promise

contextId.information: This can be stated in positive and active form. AT: "in order that God would perfect us and them together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that without us, they would not be made perfect

contextId.information: "who have been trained by discipline." The discipline or correction done by the Lord is spoken of as if it were the Lord himself. This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God has trained by disciplining them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who have been trained by it

contextId.information: This means that believers in Christ have not come to a physical mountain like Mount Sinai that a person can touch or see. This can be stated in active form. AT: "that a person can touch" or "that people can perceive with their senses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that can be touched

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must stone it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it must be stoned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God has made perfect" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who have been made perfect

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will remove all things that shake" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the removal of those things that can be shaken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that God has created" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that have been created

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as if you were in prison with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as if you were bound with them

contextId.information: This phrase encourages believers to think about other people's suffering as they would think about their own suffering. AT: "as if you were the one suffering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as if you also were them in the body

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "while the priests burned the animals' bodies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: while their bodies are burned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that God will quickly remove the things that stop my coming to you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that I will be returned to you sooner
